metadata.description: The friendly name for the workbook that is used in the Gallery or Saved List.  This name must be unique within a resource group.
The unique guid for this workbook instance

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
where type =~ 'microsoft.avs/privateclouds'
| summarize Count = count() by subscriptionId
	| order by Count desc
	| extend Rank = row_number()
	| project value = subscriptionId, label = subscriptionId, selected = Rank == 1

parameters.name: AVSInstance
parameters.label: AVS Instance
parameters.query:
resources 
| where type contains 'microsoft.avs/privatecloud'
| project value = id, label = name

content.json: # This workbook shows information relevant to deployed Azure VMware Solutions

# Change Log

### Version 1
This is the origional version of the AVS workbooks and features:
- A summary of the AVS soltuons deployed
- Metrics performance view
- Activity section related to AVS

Version 2
Added VMware resource view

### Version 3 
Added VM Information 

### Version 4
Added Alert information

### Version 5
Added help for configuring Alerts

### Version 6
- Added Advisor recommendations
- Added impact filter for Advisor recommendations
- Added status VM tools

### Version 7
Added help for Activity tab view

### Version 8
- Added syslog information
- Enabled more info layout  for syslog
- Presented workspace parameter in general as visible instead of hidden

### Version 9
Added map location view including filter for AVS instace and VM views

### Version 10
- Added AVS quota map and information
- Added additional paramater to filter AVS instance at root level for summary and locations views
- Added vCenter filter to VM view
- bugfixes and performance enhancements

content.query:
resources 
| where type contains 'microsoft.avs/privatecloud'
| where id in ({AVSInstance})
| extend SKU1 = tostring(sku.name)
| extend endpoints = properties.endpoints
| extend availability = tostring(properties.availability.strategy)
| extend clustersize = tostring(properties.managementCluster.clusterSize)
| extend hosts = properties.managementCluster.hosts
//| mv-expand hosts
| extend expressRouteID = tostring(properties.circuit.expressRouteID)
| project id, hosts,location, SKU1, clustersize, availability, expressRouteID,name //endpoints
content.title: AVS Summary

content.json: Select an AVS instance to show performance information

content.query:
resources
| where type contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere" and type !contains "virtualmachines" and type !contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualnetworks" and type !contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualmachinetemplates"
| extend resource = tolower(tostring(split(type, "/")[1]))
| summarize count(resource) by resource

resources
| where type contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere" and type !contains "virtualmachines" and type !contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualnetworks" and type !contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualmachinetemplates"
| extend resource = tolower(tostring(split(type, "/")[1]))
| extend Tag = iff(notempty(tags),tags,"No Tags")
//| extend RGID = strcat({Subscription},"/resourceGroups/",resourceGroup)
| project id,resource,  resourceGroup, Tag//, RGID
| order by resource
content.title: All Resources

content.query:
resources
| where type contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere" and type !contains "virtualmachines" and type !contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualnetworks" and type !contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualmachinetemplates"
| extend resource = tolower(tostring(split(type, "/")[1]))
| extend Tag = iff(notempty(tags),tags,"No Tags")
| where resource == "{R}"
| project id,resource,  resourceGroup, Tag
| order by resource
content.title: {R}

parameters.name: LatestToolsVer
parameters.query:
resources
| where type ==  "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualmachines" 
| extend toolsVersion = toint(properties.osProfile.toolsVersion)
| project toolsVersion
| order by toolsVersion desc
| top 1 by toolsVersion

parameters.name: vCenter
parameters.query:
resources
| where type ==  "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualmachines" 
| extend VSID = tolower(tostring(split(properties.vCenterId, "/")[8]))
| project VSID

content.query:
resources
| where type ==  "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere/virtualmachines" 
| extend VSID = tolower(tostring(split(properties.vCenterId, "/")[8]))
| where VSID in ({vCenter})
| extend OS = properties.osProfile
| extend computerName = properties.osProfile.computerName
| extend osType = properties.osProfile.osType
| extend osName = properties.osProfile.osName
| extend toolsRunningStatus = properties.osProfile.toolsRunningStatus
| extend toolsVersion = toint(properties.osProfile.toolsVersion)
| extend cores = properties.hardwareProfile.numCoresPerSocket
| extend mem = properties.hardwareProfile.memorySizeMB
| extend CPUs = properties.hardwareProfile.numCPUs
| extend Power =  properties.powerState
| project id, VSID, osType, osName,CPUs, cores, mem, Power,toolsRunningStatus, toolsVersion

content.json:
In order to deploy alerts you will need the resource ID for the AVS instance you want to be alerted on. Alerts will also need to be deployed for each seperate AVS instance.

To get the resource ID, navigate to the Overview blade of the required AVS instance and click on **"JSON View"** in the top right corner. The ID will be at the top of the fly out menu and looks as follow:

**Example:** /subscriptions/"subscription ID"/resourceGroups/"Resource Group"/providers/Microsoft.AVS/privateClouds/"AVS instance name"

content.query:
alertsmanagementresources
| extend FireTime = todatetime(properties.essentials.startDateTime), 
         Severity = tostring(properties.essentials.severity), 
         MonitorCondition = tostring(properties.essentials.monitorCondition), 
         AlertTarget = tostring(properties.essentials.targetResourceType), 
         MonitorService = tostring(properties.essentials.monitorService)
| where FireTime {TimeRange}
| extend AlertTarget = case(
        MonitorService == 'ActivityLog Administrative', 'ActivityLog',
        AlertTarget == 'microsoft.insights/components', 'App Insights',
        AlertTarget == 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces', 'Log Analytics', 
        AlertTarget)
| extend Total = "TotalAlerts"
| where (id contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere") or (id contains "microsoft.avs/privatecloud")
| summarize TotalAlerts= count(MonitorCondition) by Total
content.title: Alert Summary

content.query:
alertsmanagementresources
| where (id contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere") or (id contains "microsoft.avs/privatecloud")
| extend FireTime = todatetime(properties.essentials.startDateTime), 
         Severity = tostring(properties.essentials.severity), 
         MonitorCondition = tostring(properties.essentials.monitorCondition), 
         AlertTarget = tostring(properties.essentials.targetResourceType), 
         MonitorService = tostring(properties.essentials.monitorService)
| where FireTime {TimeRange}
| extend AlertTarget = case(
        MonitorService == 'ActivityLog Administrative', 'ActivityLog',
        AlertTarget == 'microsoft.insights/components', 'App Insights',
        AlertTarget == 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces', 'Log Analytics', 
        AlertTarget)
| summarize count() by Severity
content.title: Severity Summary

content.query:
alertsmanagementresources
| where (id contains "microsoft.connectedvmwarevsphere") or (id contains "microsoft.avs/privatecloud")
| extend FireTime = todatetime(properties.essentials.startDateTime), 
         LastModifiedTime = todatetime(properties.essentials.lastModifiedDateTime),
         Severity = tostring(properties.essentials.severity), 
         MonitorCondition = tostring(properties.essentials.monitorCondition), 
         AlertTarget = tostring(properties.essentials.targetResourceType), 
         MonitorService = tostring(properties.essentials.monitorService),
         ResolvedTime = todatetime(properties.essentials.monitorConditionResolvedDateTime)
| where FireTime {TimeRange}
| extend AlertTarget = case(
                MonitorService == 'ActivityLog Administrative', 'ActivityLog',
                AlertTarget == 'microsoft.insights/components', 'App Insights',
                AlertTarget == 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces', 'Log Analytics', 
                AlertTarget)          
| mv-expand Condition = properties.context.context.condition.allOf
| extend SignalLogic = case(
                MonitorService == "VM Insights - Health", strcat("VM Health for ", properties.essentials.targetResourceName, " Changed from ", properties.context.monitorStateBeforeAlertCreated, " to ", properties.context.monitorStateWhenAlertCreated),
                AlertTarget == "ActivityLog", strcat("When the Activity Log has Category = ", properties.context.context.activityLog.properties.eventCategory, " and Signal name = ", properties.context.context.activityLog.properties.message),
                MonitorService == "Smart Detector", strcat(properties.SmartDetectorName, " Detected failure rate of ", properties.DetectedFailureRate, " above normal failure rate of ", properties.context.NormalFailureRate),
                MonitorService == "Log Analytics", strcat("Alert when ", properties.context.AlertType, " is ", properties.context.AlertThresholdOperator, " threshold ", properties.context.AlertThresholdValue),
                MonitorService == "ActivityLog Autoscale", strcat(properties.context.context.activityLog.operationName, " from ", properties.context.context.activityLog.properties.oldInstancesCount, " to ", properties.context.context.activityLog.properties.newInstancesCount),
                strcat("Alert when metric ", Condition.metricName, Condition.timeAggregation, " is ", Condition.operator, " threshold ", Condition.threshold)),
         Query = case(
                 MonitorService == "Log Alerts V2", tostring(Condition.searchQuery),
                 MonitorService == "Log Analytics", tostring(properties.context.SearchQuery), "N/A"),
         MetricValue = iff(MonitorService == "Log Analytics", toint(properties.context.ResultCount), toint(Condition.metricValue)),
         ResourceName = iff(AlertTarget == "ActivityLog", properties.context.context.activityLog.subscriptionId, tostring(properties.essentials.targetResourceName))
| extend OpenTime = iff(MonitorCondition == "Resolved", datetime_diff('minute', ResolvedTime, FireTime), datetime_diff('minute', now(), FireTime)),
         Details = pack_all()
| project name, AlertTarget, id, subscriptionId, MonitorCondition, FireTime, LastModifiedTime, OpenTime, SignalLogic, Query, MetricValue, ResourceName, Details

AVSSyslog 
| where HostName in ({HostName})
| where AppName in ({AppName})
| where Severity in ({Severity}) or '*' in ({Severity})
| summarize count() by Severity
content.title: Count of records by severity

content.json: Enable collection of SysLog to your Log Analytics workspace with diagnostic settings on your AVS instance.

content.query:
AVSSyslog 
| where HostName in ({HostName})
| where AppName in ({AppName})
| where Severity in ({Severity}) or '*' in ({Severity})
| project TimeGenerated, HostName, AppName, Facility, Severity, Message

content.json: ### Azure Advisor recommendations for Azure VMware Solution

parameters.name: Impact
parameters.query:
AdvisorResources
| where type == 'microsoft.advisor/recommendations'
| extend imp = tostring(properties.impact)
| distinct imp

content.query:
AdvisorResources
| where type == 'microsoft.advisor/recommendations'
| where properties.resourceMetadata.source contains "AVS" or properties.resourceMetadata.source contains "vmware"
| extend SD = tostring(properties.shortDescription.solution)
| extend cat = tostring(properties.category)
| extend imp = tostring(properties.impact)
| extend LU = tostring(properties.lastUpdated)
| extend IR = tostring(properties.impactedValue)
| where imp in ({Impact}) //or '*' in ({Impact})
| project IR, resourceGroup, SD, cat, imp, LU,subscriptionId

content.json:
**In order for this section to display activity data first ensure that Azure activity log collection from your AVS Private Cloud to Log Analytics is enabled.**

This can be done from the Activity log blade of Azure Monitor.

If this is not enabled you may see the following message **"'project' operator: Failed to resolve scalar expression named 'message'"**

content.query:
AzureActivity 
| where ResourceProviderValue =="MICROSOFT.AVS"
| extend prop = parse_json(Properties)
| evaluate bag_unpack(prop)
| project TimeGenerated, message, Level, ActivityStatusValue, Caller
content.title: AVS Activity

content.query:
where  type == "microsoft.avs/privateclouds"
| where id in ({AVSInstance})
| summarize count() by location
content.title: AVS Instance Locations

content.json: ### Select a subscription to access quota information

# Legend
- Red: No quota remaining
- Yellow:  3 quota remaining
- Green: > 3 quota remaining
